docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. economic recovery has accentuated rather than eased inequalities, another reason why health reform is so important.
docs.snippet: The U.S. economic recovery has accentuated rather than eased inequalities, another reason why health reform is so important.

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans are feeling more doubtful about an overhaul of the health care system than they were in September, according to a new Gallup poll. The House narrowly approved health care legislation late Saturday night, but the poll, which was conducted from Thursday through Sunday, asked about only the prospects for a health care overhaul in general.
docs.abstract: Gallup poll shows that Americans are feeling more doubtful about overhaul of health care system; respondents are evenly split over whether Congress should approve any health care legislation (M)
docs.snippet: Americans are feeling more doubtful about an overhaul of the health care system than they were in September, according to a new Gallup poll.     The House narrowly approved health care legislation late Saturday night, but the poll, which was...

docs.lead_paragraph: When critics of the House health care bill attack it, they often bring up its length, as if the number of pages signifies nefarious intent. Two Republican opponents of the bill, Representatives Steve King of Iowa and Peter Hoekstra of Michigan, unspooled a serpentine scroll version of it on the Capitol steps on Saturday. But for some who take a quantitative approach to legal studies, the House bill is not such a big deal.
docs.abstract: Critics of House health care bill often bring up its length, as if number of pages signifies nefarious intent; Daniel Martin Katz and Michael Bommarito II at University of Michigan perform quantitave analysis of bill and determine that its length is not extraorinary; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: As the health care reform bill moves to the Senate, Democrats will struggle to get the 60 votes needed to open the bill for debate.  David M. Herszenhorn reports.

headline.main: Health Care Debate Moves to the Senate
headline.sub: If Anything, the Senate's Task Is Trickier

docs.snippet: As the health care reform bill moves to the Senate, Democrats will struggle to get the 60 votes needed to open the bill for debate.  David M. Herszenhorn reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: From coast to coast, House Democrats on Monday trumpeted their victory in approving the big health care legislation, even as they acknowledged with some trepidation that the fate of the legislation in the Senate is far from certain.

headline.main: From the House Leadership, Sighs of Relief

docs.abstract: Representative George Miller, Democrat of California, recalls months of difficult negotiations.
docs.snippet: Representative George Miller, Democrat of California, recalls months of difficult negotiations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last month, we explored the many extra costs that same-sex couples incur because their unions are not recognized by the federal government. But we'd like that story to serve as a conversation starter. Now that we know the issues -- extra health insurance costs, potentially higher tax bills, estate-planning hurdles, to name a few -- we plan on exploring them in more detail. Right here.

headline.main: What If You're Gay? A New Feature.

docs.abstract: An introduction to a recurring feature on Bucks that focuses on financial issues facing the gay and lesbian community.
docs.snippet: An introduction to a recurring feature on Bucks that focuses on financial issues facing the gay and lesbian community.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health care bill passed by the House of Representatives over the weekend eliminates a tax penalty for same-sex couples who receive health benefits from employers, but whether the final legislation will include the provision is another story.

headline.main: Potentially One Less Tax Penalty for Gay Couples

docs.abstract: The House of Representatives' health care bill eliminates a health benefits tax penalty for same-sex couples, but whether final health care legislation will include the provision is another story.
docs.snippet: The House of Representatives' health care bill eliminates a health benefits tax penalty for same-sex couples, but whether final health care legislation will include the provision is another story.

docs.lead_paragraph: An ache has hit the belly of investors who feasted on initial public offerings in Asia, in a sign that the primary equity window that saw a big revival two quarters ago is quickly beginning to shut.

headline.main: Enthusiasm for I.P.O.'s Starts to Fade Across Asia
